line.text: Not from the stars do I my judgement pluck
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And yet methinks I have astronomy
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But not to tell of good or evil luck
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Of plagues of dearths or seasons quality
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor can I fortune to brief minutes tell
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Pointing to each his thunder rain and wind
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Or say with princes if it shall go well
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: By oft predict that I in heaven find
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But from thine eyes my knowledge I derive
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And constant stars in them I read such art
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As truth and beauty shall together thrive
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If from thy self to store thou wouldst convert
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Or else of thee this I prognosticate
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Thy end is truth and beauty doom and date
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
